reviews.text: the combat in Babylon’s Fall can be fun initially but grows repetitive and stale quickly

Players are equipped with a weird device called a ‘Gideon Coffin’ which holds the players weapons and allows them to equip 4 at a time. The use of 4 weapons at once is fun in practice and allows for some cool damage setups but little else
the combat in Babylon’s Fall is extremely limited with most combos happening just by simply holding the appropriate button
the designs of most enemies are boring and repetitive... Players will spend their time running down mostly empty hallways
It’s clearly a ‘Game as a Service’... cash shop... prominently displayed... $59.99 (or $99.99 for deluxe)
This is hands down the ugliest game... bland, dull overly animated mess... ‘brush stroke’ effect... just plain ugly
the story is pretty all over the place... makes more sense than this story
Everything unfolds at a snail’s pace... can’t craft weapons or utilize the true power of the ‘Gideon Coffin’ until later
Even the co-op is boring... no cool team-up combos
they toned down [brush strokes] in the final release... you won’t get sick from looking at it in motion
It just feels like its supposed to be a free-to-play game, nothing about it screams its asking price
Players will create a Sentinal with a limited character creator in order to ascend the tower of Babylon
It’s all very ‘FromSoftware’ in its approach to the story reveal but its not done ANYWHERE near as well as Elden Ring
There is a cash shop, because of course there is and its very prominently displayed and explained
Avengers at least looks freaking fantastic AND has a great single player story; Babylon’s Fall unfortunately can’t say it has either
Everything about this game is just so puzzling that I am starting to think that maybe its some sort of meta deal
